document: Chapter 04 - Processing Crime and Incident Scenes.ppt

questions.question: What is digital evidence considered by courts?
options: As physical evidence, treated as a tangible object
questions.answer: As physical evidence, treated as a tangible object

questions.question: What organization sets standards for recovering, preserving, and examining digital evidence?
options: Scientific Working Group on Digital Evidence (SWGDE)
International Association of Computer Investigative Specialists (IACIS)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
questions.answer: Scientific Working Group on Digital Evidence (SWGDE)

questions.question: How are computer records typically divided for evidence purposes?
questions.answer: Computer-generated records and computer-stored records

questions.question: What is the business-record exception?
options: An exception that allows private companies to avoid evidence rules
An exception that allows 'records of regularly conducted activity' as admissible evidence
An exception for small businesses to use simplified evidence procedures
An exception that eliminates the need for search warrants in corporate investigations
questions.answer: An exception that allows 'records of regularly conducted activity' as admissible evidence

questions.question: What is the best evidence rule?
options: The rule that digital evidence is always superior to physical evidence
The rule that requires the original writing, recording, or photograph to prove content
The rule that allows any copy of evidence to be used in court
The rule that prioritizes witness testimony over documentary evidence
questions.answer: The rule that requires the original writing, recording, or photograph to prove content

questions.question: What can ISPs investigate without legal restrictions?
options: Computer abuse committed by their employees
All network traffic passing through their systems
questions.answer: Computer abuse committed by their employees

questions.question: What should companies display to reserve the right to inspect computing assets?
options: A warning banner and published policy
questions.answer: A warning banner and published policy

questions.question: What is required for law enforcement to search for and seize criminal evidence?
questions.answer: Probable cause

questions.question: What does the Fourth Amendment require for search warrants?
options: Warrants must be approved by multiple judges
Warrants must particularly describe the place to be searched and things to be seized
Warrants are not required for digital evidence
Warrants must be executed within 24 hours
questions.answer: Warrants must particularly describe the place to be searched and things to be seized

questions.question: What is a limiting phrase in a search warrant?
options: A phrase that limits the time allowed for the search
A phrase that allows police to separate innocent information from evidence
A phrase that restricts the tools that can be used
A phrase that limits the number of officers on scene
questions.answer: A phrase that allows police to separate innocent information from evidence

questions.question: What is the plain view doctrine's status in digital forensics?
options: It is fully accepted and commonly used
It is being rejected and not acceptable
It only applies to network traffic
It applies only to corporate investigations
questions.answer: It is being rejected and not acceptable

questions.question: What should investigators create before going to a scene?
questions.answer: An initial-response field kit

questions.question: What is AFIS used for at crime scenes?
options: Identifying fingerprints connected to a central database
questions.answer: Identifying fingerprints connected to a central database

questions.question: What is professional curiosity at a crime scene?
options: When professionals ask too many questions
When unauthorized personnel examine evidence, potentially destroying it
questions.answer: When unauthorized personnel examine evidence, potentially destroying it

questions.question: When should you cut electrical power to a running computer system?
options: Only on older Windows 9x or MS-DOS systems
Only when instructed by a supervisor
questions.answer: Only on older Windows 9x or MS-DOS systems

questions.question: What information should be tagged on collected evidence?
options: Only the date and collector's name
Date, time, serial numbers, make/model, and collector's name
questions.answer: Date, time, serial numbers, make/model, and collector's name

questions.question: What is sparse acquisition used for?
options: Extracting only data related to evidence from large systems
Recovering deleted files from free space
questions.answer: Extracting only data related to evidence from large systems

questions.question: What is a drawback of sparse acquisition?
options: It takes too long to perform
It doesn't recover data in free or slack space
It cannot be used in court
questions.answer: It doesn't recover data in free or slack space

questions.question: What media has a typical lifespan of 30 years for evidence storage?
questions.answer: 4-mm DAT magnetic tapes

questions.question: What is Super Digital Linear Tape (SDLT) designed for?
questions.answer: Large RAID data backups

questions.question: How many copies of every image should be made to prevent data loss?
questions.answer: Two copies

questions.question: What does CRC stand for in digital forensics?
questions.answer: Cyclic Redundancy Check

questions.question: What are the three rules for forensic hashes?
options: Unpredictable, unique, and changeable when data changes
questions.answer: Unpredictable, unique, and changeable when data changes

questions.question: What organization developed the SHA-1 hashing algorithm?
options: International Association of Computer Investigative Specialists (IACIS)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
questions.answer: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

questions.question: What is a keyed hash set?
options: A hash created by an encryption utility's secret key
A hash that only works with specific software
A hash that changes based on the time of day
A hash that requires physical keys to generate
questions.answer: A hash created by an encryption utility's secret key
